org.barghos.core.color

Class PLDRColor3

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.barghos.core.color.PLDRColor3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IColor3R, ILDRColor3R, ITup3fR, ITup3R, ITupfR, ITupR

    public abstract class PLDRColor3
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILDRColor3R
    This class is a readonly implementation of an LDRColor3.

    • Method Summary

      This generate a readonly PLDRColor3 with the components set to scalar.

    • Method Detail

      • gen

        public static PLDRColor3 gen(ITup3fR t)
        This generate a readonly PLDRColor3 with the components set to t. The values of t are interpreted as in unitspace (0.0 - 1.0) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        t - A tuple that the components are set to.
        Returns:
        A new readonly PLDRColor3 with the given components.

      • gen

        public static PLDRColor3 gen(float scalar)
        This generate a readonly PLDRColor3 with the components set to scalar. The scalar is interpreted as in unitspace (0.0 - 1.0) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        scalar - A value that the components are set to.
        Returns:
        A new readonly PLDRColor3 with the given components.

      • gen

        public static PLDRColor3 gen(float r,
                             float g,
                             float b)
        This generate a readonly PLDRColor3 with the components set to r, g and b. r, g and b are interpreted as in unitspace (0.0 - 1.0) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component in unitspace.
        g - The green component in unitspace.
        b - The blue component in unitspace.
        Returns:
        A new readonly PLDRColor3 with the given components.

      • gen

        public static PLDRColor3 gen(int scalar)
        This generate a readonly PLDRColor3 with the components set to scalar. The scalar is interpreted as in colorrange (0 - 255) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        scalar - A value that the components are set to.
        Returns:
        A new readonly PLDRColor3 with the given components.

      • gen

        public static PLDRColor3 gen(int r,
                             int g,
                             int b)
        This generate a readonly PLDRColor3 with the components set to r, g and b. r, g and b are interpreted as in colorspace (0 - 255) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component in colorspace.
        g - The green component in colorspace.
        b - The blue component in colorspace.
        Returns:
        A new readonly PLDRColor3 with the given components.
